result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: DE called stating late on Atty fee Payment. DE stated will be paying within the next couple days. Clerk provided DE with allpaid information or to come to Clerk of Court office to pay bill. arc

Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore in court for Hunter James Ratliff. Set for PLEAS.  Atty. Larimore states DE paid for AODA assessment, requests additional time for DE to complete. Court resets PLEAS. Misdemeanor and Criminal Traffic Scheduling Order. Signed by SJN on 6/20/2022. c: DA and Atty via e-file. km

10:50 AM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA: Michael Joseph Becker, DE: Hunter James Ratliff pro se. DE filed PFAC just prior to court today, Court reviews PFAC. Court approves and signs PFAC, attorney to be appointed, payments of $75 per month. Court notes previously scheduled hearings. Adjourned: 10:51 AM. kma

Status conference on June 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Settlement conference on July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

01:25 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: B. Berhow, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker and Intern Connor Smith, DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson for today, DF:  Hunter James Ratliff appeared for jail. Court reviews case, bond set yesterday, DE does not qualify for public defender, PFAC was given to DE yesterday. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. NG, pre-plea rights preserved. Court sets STC for attorney status, SETC and PSC. Adjourned: 1:33 PM. kma  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Settlement conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:05 PM    CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: Liddle.   ADA: Michael Becker  DF ATTY: Travis Satorius for today   Defendant Hunter James Ratliff appeared from jail. ADA Becker states DE taken into custody over the weekend and has outstanding warrant from Waupaca. No complaint filed yet. ADA Becker requests bond be set. DE doesn't qualify for PD- PFAC given. Court sets INIT for tomorrow.

Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.
